title: Overall [0â€“4]
stimulusHtml:
Scoring Criteria (Score Scale 0-4)

4 Correctly discusses at least three reasons why the 19th-century public and/or critics reacted as they did to these two very different kinds of paintings. Both works are discussed. There are no significant errors.

3 Correctly discusses at least three reasons why the 19th-century public and/or critics reacted as they did to these two very different kinds of paintings. Both works are discussed. There are some errors.

2 Correctly discusses two reasons why the 19th-century public and/or critics reacted as they did to these very different kinds of paintings. One work may not be discussed. There may be some errors.

1 Correctly discusses one reason why the 19th-century public and/or critics reacted as they did to these very different kinds of paintings. One work may not be discussed. There may be some errors.

0 Student makes an attempt, but answer is without merit because it rewrites the question or makes only incorrect statements.
descriptions: Student makes an attempt, but answer is without merit because it rewrites the question or makes only incorrect statements.
Correctly discusses one reason why the 19th-century public and/or critics reacted as they did to these very different kinds of paintings. One work may not be discussed. There may be some errors.
Correctly discusses two reasons why the 19th-century public and/or critics reacted as they did to these very different kinds of paintings. One work may not be discussed. There may be some errors.

Correctly discusses at least three reasons why the 19th-century public and/or critics reacted as they did to these two very different kinds of paintings. Both works are discussed. There are some errors.

Correctly discusses at least three reasons why the 19th-century public and/or critics reacted as they did to these two very different kinds of paintings. Both works are discussed. There are no significant errors.
